oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1940-10-05 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from October 5, 1940 (year unconfirmed). Featuring Louie Buck (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Ford Rush, Bill Monroe and his Blue Grass Boys, Bashful Brother Oswald, and Rachel Veach. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Bashful Brother Oswald; Rachel Veach; Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Opry House Gang; Ford Rush; Bill Monroe; Blue Grass Boys
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Three Men Went A-Hunting (Bashful Brother Oswald, Rachel Veach) [continued from part 1] -- Prince Albert commercial (George D. Hay, Louie Buck) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff -- Blue Eyed Darling (Roy Acuff) -- George D. Hay introduces the 'Opry House Gang' -- Soldier's Joy (Opry House Gang) -- George D. Hay introduces Ford Rush -- Swing The Ladies Up And Down (Ford Rush) -- George D. Hay introduces Bill Monroe and his Blue Grass Boys -- Cryin' Holy Unto The Lord (Bill Monroe and his Blue Grass Boys) -- Prince Albert commercial (George D. Hay, Louie Buck) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys -- Eighth Of January (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Closing statement (George D. Hay) -- Closing statement (Louie Buck)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Rush, Ford, 1895-; Veach, Rachel; Bashful Brother Oswald; Monroe, Bill, 1911-1996; Blue Grass Boys; McGar, Mac
